description.narrative: This project is fundamentally about capacity building and empowerment. The project is building capacity of women farmers which is contributing to the achievement of purpose and outputs in the following ways: 1) The women groups will be trained in improved agriculture techniques. This will be conducted by the Farming Instructors through out the project period. The Farming Instructors have all been part of similar program and are well trained in the subject matter. The training will both give the women farmers solid back ground knowledge and hands on training in the demonstration gardens . Included in the training will be courses in basic business management. Each beneficiary will be encouraged to start a small business to supplement family income. 2) The women farmers will also be trained in what it means to be food secured and the concept of a balanced diet. 3) The capacity to work together as a group to achieve one goal will also be built among the target beneficiaries via organizational structure, In the 2nd project year min 2 cooperatives will be established and run by the women farmers them selves. Around 50% of the women farmers will be in each. In each cooperative processing plants for soy beans, ground nuts and pulses, vegetables and fruits will be established to increase the value for crops they will be growing. 4) The women farmers will be in installing sealed rope and washer pumps to increase access to drinking water and water for irrigation. The women farmers will also be trained in irrigation and they will establish each an irrigated garden for vegetable production not depending on the rains. This production will both increase the cash income and the nutrition level of the household .5) the participating women farmers will furthermore advocate for the applicability of other project activities to other members who are their neighbours. For example the use of potholing method for planting maize which is more essential in areas with low rainfall which will advocated for in the target area. Campaigns on healing the environment will be introduced in the entire community and programs will be ongoing to ensure that everyone take part and contribute. ;
